critique: This executive order concerns the revocation of a previous order withdrawing certain lands in California and Nevada, opening them up for homesteading and desert-land laws, initially prioritizing ex-service men. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a broad sense, or national security. It touches on federalism insofar as it manages federal lands, but doesn't dramatically shift the balance. It has a slight economic regulation aspect by opening up land for homesteading, and a slight social inclusion aspect by prioritizing ex-service men.
